heading: Eligibility
rule: Participants must be at least 18 years of age and have a valid email address to participate in the hackathon.

heading: Submission
rule: All submissions must be made through the designated submission form before the deadline. Submissions must include a link to a functioning website and a short description of the project.

heading: Original work
rule: All work submitted must be original and created during the duration of the hackathon. Plagiarism or copyright infringement will result in disqualification.

heading: Technologies
rule: Participants are free to use any programming language, frameworks, or technologies to develop their project.

heading: Code repository
rule: Participants must use a code repository such as GitHub to store their project code, and resposetory must not be private.

heading: Changes
rule: The organizers reserve the right to make changes to the rules and regulations at any time before or during the hackathon.

heading: Prizes
rule: Prizes will be awarded to the top three participants. The prizes will be announced at the start of the hackathon.

heading: Judging
rule: Projects will be judged based on creativity, functionality, user experience, and overall description.

heading: Disqualification
rule: The organizers reserve the right to disqualify any participant who violates the rules and regulations.
